comments: One of my favorite professors at Wor-Wic. He brings lots of humor to his lectures and makes things easy to understand. He is very open about his beliefs and ideas. He will also try to make your life easier with fewer papers/projects. There is also a lot of freedom with the papers/projects. I wasn\'t expecting this class to be as interesting as it is

comments: When I took the class, all you were graded for is like four tests, the final, and a research paper. The research paper was tough, though. The few sources he limited us to use were difficult, and it was hard to find what I needed, but he allows for up to 100 extra credit points, so that could significantly make up for tests or research paper.

comments: I\'ve had Mr. Pavese twice, right now I\'m taking his online HIS151 class. I had him last semester for a campus HIS101 class and learned a lot. His lectures are clear and concise, he will take the time to help you, and he connects history to current events in a clever way. Very thought provoking, intelligent man.

comments: Very intellectual professor who tells history like it is, ties things into current events, and frequently opens up the class to discussion and debate. Best professor I\'ve ever had, and the funnest and most interesting lectures I\'ve ever attended.

comments: Pavese is the best! Keeps lectures interesting and definitely knows his information. He gets to know the students and class is actually fun. He grades on a curve but does not give out study guides or allow notes at all. I would love to take another one of his classes.

comments: Mr. Pavese is a great professor and inspiration. It\'s a shame he no longer heads the Honors Department, but that\'s mainly due to the stuck up old biddies that don\'t approve of his teaching style and personal views. I have learned so much from this man. He has changed the course of my life.

comments: Pavese is a great teacher. I have now taken three of his classes. If you need help he\'s there. He brings humor into the class, which causes him to go a little off point sometimes but it\'s okay. I recommend going to class bc he will sometimes extend dates for assignments due or will give out extra credit opportunities that he won\'t announce online.

comments: Lectures are long but he finds a way to relate the subject matter to real life in an understandable and funny way. He is not very organized in his lectures, and you never know what is important. Tests are very long, difficult, and tricky. A lot of the information on the tests is not in his lectures. If you are a visual learner he is not for you!

comments: Professor Pavese is wonderful at explaining what you need to know, and if you come to class, participate then you will have no problems passing this class with an easy A. If you don\'t come to class, cut out early, or expect to take the easy road then don\'t bother taking his class, because you won\'t pass. He makes his lectures and lessons amazing.

comments: Best teacher I\'ve ever had at Wor Wic. He always had something interesting to talk about, and always stayed relevant to topics. Overall really opened my mind to many things. Attendance wasn\'t mandatory, but I still attended almost every class because he made it interesting. Take a lot of notes and do all of the assignments and it\'s an easy course.

comments: I took this as an online course in Summer I. The class was easy structured, the study guide covered the final perfectly. You can work ahead with everything and finish early. I am taking the following history class online in Summer II. Can\'t wait.

comments: I have never had a better instructor. He is brilliant and introduces students to the concept of real thinking and not just teaching off of a test. You would be doing yourself a real disservice not to take his classes.

comments: A very interesting and engaging teacher, he made learning history fun. He would describe historical evens as if he was telling a story, and then start class discussions that often went into philosophy, politics, current events, psychology...you name it, we talked about it in this class. Also a very easy class. I would recommend him highly.
